alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 3:41PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Koyukuk River Downstream of Allakaket to Hughes. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas is expected. Gravel bars will be submerged. Water will flow over banks into low lying areas and sloughs. Logs and other debris will fill the river. In Hughes, low lying areas of village and near the runway could see minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM AKDT Monday, between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell over the headwaters of the Koyukuk River late last week. That high water continues to move down the Koyukuk River. The crest is expected to reach Hughes Tuesday evening. - For Koyukuk River at Hughes: At 200pm Monday, the stage was 61.0 feet. Flood Stage is 64.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 63.9 feet is expected around 1000pm Tuesday. - weather.gov/aprfc People along the Koyukuk River downstream of Allakaket to Hughes should move valuables to higher ground and prepare for rising water levels.
